intro: Mammillaria cylindracea, commonly known as the cylindrical mammillaria, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems that are covered in small, white spines. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its compact size and ornamental appearance, it is often cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and collections.
